meanings.definition: having or showing a cunning and deceitful nature
meanings.sent1: The slyest fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: She gave him a slyest smile before tricking him into believing her lies.
meanings.sent3: The slyest cat pretended to be asleep to catch the mouse off guard.
meanings.sent4: His slyest tactics in the game made him the champion.
meanings.sent5: The slyest thief stole the jewels without anyone noticing.

meanings.definition: in a cunning or deceitful manner
meanings.sent1: He looked at her slyest, trying to hide his true intentions.
meanings.sent2: She whispered slyest to her friend, plotting their next prank.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed his tricks slyest, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The spy moved slyest through the crowd, unnoticed by his target.
meanings.sent5: The con artist smiled slyest as he swindled his latest victim.
